title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message: Hello all. I got a board that was not powering on. After inspection I found corrosion around U3710. Put some flux on it, set my TR1300 station to 350 Celsius with medium airflow and gave it some heat. After 20 seconds or so the top layer seemed to pop and went back into position. I tried recalling the SMC and replacing it also, but still no green light. I have no shorts and PP3V42_G3H is present. PPBUS_G3H is 8.15V instead of 8.56V. I think that popped layer broke something internally to the board. Any way to verify that or the board is junk?

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message: Do you get correct SMC_RESET_L first?

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message: SMC_RESET_L is pulsing

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message: Replaced U5110 and now I get around 0.5V on SMC_RESET_L

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message:
No good; check R5100.
3V42_G3H and PPBUS_G3H pulsing?

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message:
R5100@100K
3V42 = 3.42V Stable
PPBUS_G3H = 8.16V stable

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message:
Remove first U7100.
If still the same, disconnect trackpad flex and test again.
If still low, clean/remove J6100.

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message: Correct me if I'm wrong, but by what I understood of what you told I should remove U7100 and plug in the board? Would't that fry the board because the lack of PWM control?

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message: Sorry, my mistake; read R7100 instead...

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message: Removed R7100 and J6100. Still same

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message:
"disconnect trackpad flex and test again."
Did?

Remove U5110 and check SMC_RESET_L level.

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message: It's out the case. Nothing but IO board and cable connected. Removed U5110 and still Low SMC_RESET_L, around 1,1V and going down up to 0.5V

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message:
Change R5100, just in case.
Also heat SMC, to burn eventually accumulated crap underneath.

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message: Replaced the resistor and recalled SMC. Same thing. I had already tried replacing the SMC before but same results.

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message:
So you had SMC removed from the board.
Did you check SMC_RESET_L level then?

Post now all U5110 voltages.

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message:
U5110:

Pin 1 - 3.42V
Pin 2 - 0V
Pin 3 - 3.4V
Pin 4 - 2.77V
Pin 5 - 0V
Pin 6 - 3.42V
Pin 7 - 3.4V
Pin 8 - 0V

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message:
Change U5110 again.
Post diode mode to ground at pins 5 & 8.

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message:
U5110:

Pin 1 - 3.42V
Pin 2 - 0V
Pin 3 - 3.4V
Pin 4 - 2.77V
Pin 5 - 0V
Pin 6 - 3.42V
Pin 7 - 3.4V
Pin 8 - 3.4V

Diode:

Pin 5 - 0.003
Pin 8 - 0.523

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message: Apparently, Pin 8 shorted to GND

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message: I replaced U7100, short gone and now I get orange light on charger(no green light though), but SMC_RESET_L still low near 0.9V

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message:
"Pin 8 shorted to GND"
Did you mean pin 5?

SMC_RESET_L should be good now, if you get Magsafe amber light.
Are you using original Magsafe 2 charger?

Green light only comes back when battery is fully charged.

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message: Yes, I meant Pin 5, was a mistype. Light is amber, but even without battery, normal behavior should be green light fir a couple of seconds then amber. Mine gets only amber and SMC_RESET_L is still under 1V. Yes, genuine MagSafe 2 85W charger.

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message: Remove U5110 and check SMC_RESET_L level.

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message: Well, I gave U5110 area some heat and now the board started giving SMC_RESET_L signal 3.4V. Now the board is entering S3 state. I have all power rails in sequence up to PP1V05_SUS.

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message: And... Suddenly it stopped again! Same low reading on SMC_RESET_L, no light no charger

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message:
"Remove U5110 and check SMC_RESET_L level."
Did ot?
Let the board to cool down first.

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message: Yes, same shit... No light, 1.1V on SMC RESET

title: 820-00165 Corrosion Near U3710 No Power
message: Force the signal with 33K in place of R5100.
